author: {'steamid': '76561198037741353', 'num_games_owned': 1752, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1706318589}
review:
this game is pretty bad. it's bog standard RPGMaker junk with a cliched story and stock assets. the first thing you do is wake up in a castle and have to go talk to the king in order to start your quest. i HATE games that start this way. when you do go outside the castle you get attacked by enemies that are already hitting for 100s of points worth of damage. you can actually die on your first encounter in this game, and if you don't find healing before your second you're virtually guaranteed to die. it's insane to design a game this way!!!

unfortunately, i think covid my have also killed the developers. RIP

author: {'steamid': '76561197972610203', 'num_games_owned': 5647, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1708437802}
review: I tried to give this game a shot, but it was just a really bad RPGMaker game. The castle at the beginning as well as buildings in other towns and the cathedral near the beginning... All of them are WAY too huge. Why were they so huge? Its a very grindy game, like the original Dragon Quest or Phantasy Star where you just have to sit and kill low level mobs outside the starter town until you get enough gold to buy gear that you can advance further, but like, the length of time to get back to the shop npcs or the free heals was abysmally long. I didn't realize there was a fountain at first that heals right near the cathedral, and later in the game there are healing springs almost TOO often. I didn't feel the game was balanced at all, and the dungeons were not inventive, and the building layouts were crap. All this you have to suffer through with default RPGMaker tilesets and menus and everything. Its just bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004384042', 'num_games_owned': 1119, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1666876520}
review:
Bad game. Boring mechanics, poor story, boring enemies, inneccesary long final dungeons, worst balanced enemies ever, TOO MUCH GRINDING (my god, I thought it was a corean game).

Do not buy, if else, get it on a bundle.


Six hour after writing the first review: I must say the game just keep getting worse. Even more unnecesseaty grinding. I  have bought the best equipment and become lvl 45. Best equipment, every item maxed with christonia, and I´m still getting killed in one hit, ALL ENEMIES ATTACK BEFORE ME, every status effect just go through every one of my defenses before I could cast anything. The final boss is just... an insult to every player. 
Stun and party wipe with lighting. After seven tries this is just... well, noone tried to test this combat system. IT´s just bad, really bad. 

I have played a lot of games created with rpgmaker, and man, this is one of the worst games I ever played.

Not recommended at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026050130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1627077331}
review:
Leider muss ich trotz des schönen Anfangs und nach 2 maligem durchlaufen bis Karte 3 Negativ werden.
Die Rüstungen sind einfach zu Teuer! Man soll sich 220.000 Mire erspielen was bei einem Kampf mit ca. 500 Mire pro Kampf nur 450 Kämpfe ausmacht.. nach vielen dank an die Entwickler...hab nichts besseres zu tun als sinnlos zu Grinden.. und bei Karte 4 geht das dann auch wieder nur in die 300.000 Mire mit Kämpfen bis 1000 Mire pro Kampf.. also mal eben nur 750 Kämpfe zum sinnlosen Grinden aufbringen.. oder anders gesagt 25 Stunden Grinding für nichts.. oder man Stirbt jeden 2. Kampf mit starken Gegnern wie Drachen die AOE sprüche wie ICE AGE 3 machen.

Zudem wird die Story schön erzahlt, jedoch ist anfangs die Freiheit gerade auf Karte 1 verwirrend. Es wird kaum erklärt wo man hingehen muss und nur durch Zufall oder andere Spieler die das alles schon hatten kommt man auf die richtigen Wege bis man endlich durchblick auf Karte 2-4 erhalten hat.

Story: 7/10
Gameplay 4/10
Grafik: 8/10
Sound: 6/10
Steuerung: 7/10

Overall: 6,4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198341168476', 'num_games_owned': 1639, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1545411357}
review: I mean there is some headache and not a teerible game but I have a beef about the online suggestion it gives you lols... People about the online part that gives you the option tbh I'm just as confused as you lols :D I mean why... why? like seriously why Does "Angels of Fasaria" even give you the option to go online, here at first I was thinking Fasaria World was a cliche or code name for a server so I was like you and clicked it tried to sign up and only after 30 mins later of exhausting all paths to why the Steam Key was not showing it's ugly face in my direction, it then clicked in there was 2 games... like wtf lols seriously? anyways a simple "If" statement in the code to check if that specific game file was on your computer and if it existed then yes suggest for heavens sake, but please don't suggest if the game is non existent on our PC's like what's wrong with ya lols! Seriously what language is the game programmed in and what is the game file's name for the online and I seriously can write up a working code that will save all of us some time! If you think the wild goose chase is entertaining I'm sorry to break it, "It's a big fat NO!!!" but people please listen here the programmer needs to go back to programming school there is no such thing as a Key or Online mode with just a "Standalone" version of Angels of Fasaria, as that's just an offline mode game, I mean I have in the past seen games with retro rpg graphics that were also online like runescape and maplestory but anything from RPG Maker as a whole is gonna mostly and or always be just purely offline! I looked into their 3D online game and was eeks so this the game that's online... wow... :P anyways now i have the job to write up an honest review from what I seen an saw and experienced :D oh yes my pleasure! Cracks fingures... so look this game is alright as in Offline basic RPG style game, I can tell you as it stands collect and use items, questing, be sure to save a minimum of once when creating a new game and before you leave the King about your odd dreams you had, cuz as all RPG Maker games for most part if you die you get sent back to title screen and literally have to start a new game, so scrap the auto saving features lols, I would play this casually but not as a full on game, if you want a casual game you play a few mins here or there then yes this is Otay, but I wouldn't say this is exactly material to hook you in and make you wanna play till the end! There is better quality games that exist out there that won't waste your time and 2 will auto save and 3 are alot more fun to play! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1448522672}
review:
RPG Maker strikes again! This is another low effort retro-pixel JRPG ripoff spamming the Steam catalog, made with the RPG Maker video game construction kit... in their own words, "Our easy to use tools are simple enough for a child."

This isn't even a good RPG Maker game. Originally a browser game, but somehow rebuilt apparently with RPG Maker, the developers somehow managed to make it worse, with limited gameplay, pointless grind, and toothpullingly bad story.

Gamers who want a good retro gaming experience would be better off playing the original Final Fantasy games or one of the better RPG Maker games.

[quote][url=https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/store/reviews]Developer Response![/url][/quote]

The developer has weighed in to inform everyone they didn't read the [url=https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/store/reviews]Developer Usage Rules[/url] for Steam "partners", or they deliberately ignored the part where Valve says "Though it may be tempting, not every review needs to be responded to."

As the developer helpfully points out, this is a remake of a retro pixel wannabe game from 2005, which also wasn't very good, and by their own admission, despite being a free browser game, couldn't exceed 50,000 people after they saw just how bad it was.   13 years have passed, but how little changes!  

Also, the developer has tacitly admitted they're charging $5 USD for a free browser game.  Unacceptable and highly unethical to treat PC gamers like second class citizens.

Still impossible to recommend anyone buys this.
developer_response: Brief History: Angels of Fasaria RPG was created and released during the same time of the browser based version in the 1st quarter of 2005 (over 13 years ago). Since then, players asked for us to bring it back which we submitted on Steam greenlight and players voted it in. The game is over 13 years old. It was intended for the players that still want the game in spite of its age. The browser based game had over 50k active players and the RPG tens of thousands. Sorry if it isn’t your type of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249387460', 'num_games_owned': 2746, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1499345825}
review:
Angels of Fasaria RPG is a role playing game set in a fantasy world, you play as a priest that just had a divine encounter with an angel, the angel tells you of a great evil named the Dominion's Order and that they are already conquering the entire world.The story in this game is very generic as it's just a simple tale about a hero who must save the world from a great danger.
The goal of this game is to travel across four worlds and beat all of the dungeons/stages, after that is done, you will be greeted with a final dungeon/level that you must conquer.  It sounds like a simple goal but you will find it to be a very tedious goal as in order to gain access to a dungeon/level you must collect angels.
The battle system in this game includes both random battle and on-screen enemy battle. The battles themselves are turn-based to where everybody picks what they want to do and after that you will see everybody performing their actions. 
The difficulty in this game isn't too bad as it is very beatable to anybody that doesn't play many role playing games.  This game doesn't take all that long to beat as you can beat it in around twelve to fourteen hours.  The hardest point of the game is when you are starting off in the first world as you have very low stats and the monsters will just beat you up.  The other hard point of the game is when you reach the other worlds for the first time, you are a little underpowered and have no idea what's the best method to use against the monsters.
The sound of the music is very generic but far from sounding terrible.  The animation is average and it might put some people off. 
The game is good, I would recommend that you try it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033445224', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1516458366}
review:
İlk versiyonunu oynamamış hatta duymamıştım fakat Angels of Fasaria V2 'i beni çocukluğuma geri götürdü. Televizyona takılan atarilerdeki gibi hikayesi olan oyunlara bayılırdım. Bu oyunla bir nevi nostalji yaptım diyebilirim. Fiyatıda ucuz.
     Oyuna gelince krallığın bir şövalyesiniz ve görevleri alıp tamamladıkça hem kendi leveliniz yükseliyor ve edindiğiniz itemlerle gelişiyorsunuz hemde krallığınızı kurtarıyorsunuz. Eğer ingilizceniz de mevcutse hoş ve çocukça bir hikayesi mevcut.
     Noksan yanlarına gelince büyük ekran yapamadım. Ya ben bulamadım ya da oyunda yok. Ayrıca sesi kapat aç veya azaltıp çoğaltma seçeneğide mevcut değil galiba.


I did not play the first version or even heard it, but Angels of Fasaria V2 took me back to my childhood. I loved the games that were storytelling like the ones on TV's Atari. I can say I made a kind of nostalgia with this game. It's cheap at the price.
As for the game, as your king gets a knight and your tasks are completed, your level is increased and you are developing with the items you are getting, and you are saving your kingdom. If you have English, there is a nice and childish story.
I could not make a big screen when it comes to their lack. Either I can not find it or it does not exist. Also turn off the volume or turn it off and I do not think the duplication option is available.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989421071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1451487164}
review:
4/10 you need the patience of angels for this one

Its repetetive and a grind, all in the basic graphics that are shipped with the editor. 

This is about the lamest you can produce with RPG Maker, which allows to import all kinds of custom assets and has a great built-in conversation editor.

You can kill several hours with it if you REALLY have nothing better to do but its definitely not worth the price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035826801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 643, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1473102164}
review:
Single player:

+ Monster sprites on the world map looked great
+ The background songs seemed okay

- No tutorial for all the controls.
- Controls are CXZ instead of XZC
- Too many enemies and enemies keep following you after first seeing them.
- When exploring in the first area, you can suddenly end up in a fight where you get 2 hitted.
- Can't simply press M to open and close the map - have to navigate to it from the menu.
- Enemies have no attack sounds, don't show their hitpoints and don't have interesting abilities. This makes the combat feel dull.

Not interested in multiplayer. Decided to uninstall after getting 2 hitted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999218586', 'num_games_owned': 3573, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1703842542}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]

A mediocre and boring RPG.

The developer is overzealous about policing the reviews, often dismissing legitimate concerns as "trolling" or flagging the review as off-topic. The recent steam review overhaul seems to have removed the erroneous flags however.

I get it, it's tough to take criticism about something you created, but this type of behavior is not doing you any favors. Just let the negative reviews be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996072084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1514089827}
review: This game has no menus of any kind. No options, no video settings, no control settings, nothing. The game only runs in a tiny window, which is a problem on a large monitor with a high resolution. There is no way to view the controls either, I don't mind if the keys aren't rebindable although these days that is quite unacceptable, but not even having a single menu to view the key binds, and having to randomly hit your keys to figure out what does what, is definitely unacceptable. Then there are the video settings, by which i mean there are none, this is completely unacceptable. The worst games I have ever played in my life, all had options menus with even the bare bones of configurable settings. Make some menus, at the very bare minimum add a menu to view the keybinds, and a video options menu to change the window size.
developer_response:
Remember, this was a re-release of an old game made with RPG Maker XP and it's control/video options which are very limited had not changed. You can make the screen bigger: *Full Screen: Press Alt + ENTER

For more help, refer to guide:
http://steamcommunity.com/app/335900/guides/#scrollTop=0

author: {'steamid': '76561198068182835', 'num_games_owned': 4271, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1456537478}
review:
Well you cant play multiplayer if you dont register on their website so.... no thank you

developer_response: There is no multiplayer with this game currently as this game is an RPG and nothing more (original mmo was taken down as lack of players and interest). For those who do sign up may have their benefits for any later game. If you don't want to sign up or support the mmo development, well, that is your choice but you can't expect access to a free game. Currently, sign up for potential alpha testing of the mmo version can be done on these boards. There are clear instructions there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013720439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1427038423}
review:
The game is generic and a repetitive grind from the start.  Item crafting is nonsense.  The real issue though is the developer is extremely shady.  See that MMO tag?  Guess what, this game isn't an MMO, yet they advertise it as one.  The developers originally claimed that if you purchased the game, you would receive the MMO for free.  Now that doesn't seem to be the case anymore, as they clearly state the MMO will not be a free game.  

The developer has supposedly started Alpha Testing their MMO, but in order to be considered to test, you have to buy THIS game first.  So, instead of creating a new game/MMO here on Steam and listing it as Early Access, they've taken signups to their own personal website and require that you buy this unrelated game first.  Seems like total bait to me.

Avoid this game.
developer_response:
Please Refer to our Company Policy:

http://steamcommunity.com/games/335900/announcements/detail/144444026928711876

*Side note. Please alert us when you notice any errors such as tag error.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

review:
I need to learn English.

英語分からなかったら楽しさ激減。RPGツクールもので昔ながらのRPGと言ったところ。それだけに目標を示すナビゲーションシステムやインターフェイスは簡素なものなので英語が分からなければ楽しさどころか進行で詰む可能性も。

エピックモンスターの中にはとても強力なものもいてしっかりと準備を整える必要があります。

辞書片手に挑戦しましたがペラい人じゃないと厳しいと思います。

とりあえずセールかバンドル組み込みを待つべし

author: {'steamid': '76561198023559891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1489249669}
review:
Decent game, but has too many minor annoyances to recommend.

EDIT: I was wrong about this bit. Per dev comment you can indeed play full screen - I missed this.
As of writing this review, you cannot resize game window, it is very small, ~480x480. On a 4k or higher resolution screen this makes the game unplayably small.

The side quests in this game are ones where you turn in drops for rewards. You can get multiple of the same drop to turn in. But you have to turn them in one at a time, for no reason. When you have 100's to turn in you get annoyed part way through and just say sc*** it. Seriously, turn all of the same item in at once...

A number of the areas you go to are needlessly large. Ex: castles. I'm okay with the reusing of areas from one section of the game to another, but don't make them huge for no reason. The castle's are just a HUGE room with the entrance in the middle of one wall, and the king in the middle of the opposite wall. There is literally nothing else in this massive room. Nothing on the sides or anywhere else. Grandiose is nice, this isn't it.

Complaints aside, this game has the potential to be a fun nostalgia trip to the old 2D rpg days. Acceptable story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1737, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1451815349}
review: Angels of Fasaria 2.0 is a revised version of the original Angels of Fasaria, released in 2005. This new and improved version features a 2D RPG, trading cards and more. Visually it looks like an SNES RPG, and has a plot similar to something you would find in a final fantasy game. It brings back the nostalgic days of RPGing as a kid. There is also an online version, which I haven't tested, but this is for the single player RPG only. It's decently made for an indie game and a great remake of the classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121162882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1444397662}
review:
Bei aller Liebe zu RPG Maker Spielen, aber das hier ist wirklich schlecht. 
Ich hab nur knapp über ne halbe Stunde gespielt aber das reicht mir.... die Kämpfe sind sowohl zufällig als auch über laufende Gegner, die einen berühen. Da hätte man sich entscheiden können.
Das Level System funktioniert schlecht bis garnicht. Man bekommt kaum mit wenn man auflevelt, es gibt zwar nen HP und MP Bonus und acuh ein paar Skills aber ein wirklichen Unterschied macht es nicht. 
Und dass man um Dungeons zu betreten erstmal Mana farmen muss, entweder durch Töten der Gegner oder fangen spielen mit Engeln O.o ?! 
höchst seltsam und nicht zu empfehlen

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
Review for old Ver. 1 (was more like 0.1)

Found some messages about author friends automatically downvote negative posts. So if you're not one of them write why you disagree.

[h1]I'm fan of RPG Maker games, but this...[/h1]

Don't even try to get this game for RPG (singleplayer) version until "new version" of RPG will be finished.

At start I was interrested in MMO, well even after fix using cmd. I got other error (Run-time error '5' -> after some searching it looks like "bad" code - some changes need's to be done to get rid of it).

(Q: What if game in 2015 needs manualy use cmd to fix [A: Congrat you have found unskilled "programator"])

So about singleplayer RPG features:
[list]
    [*]Most textures are default, 
    [*]RPG Maker - only resolution 4:3 (I'm used to it so even when I have 16:9 it's not problem for me)
[/list]

And singleplayer gameplay 
[list]
    [*]Story looks fine but...
    [*]At start you have sword, in first room you can take armor for ally (but you don't have ally) and no skills / spells
    [*]You have no money, or potions. [spoiler] You can sell ally armor, but you will need it later [/spoiler]
    [*][b]When you get out of castle first random encounter can kill you.[/b] (I'm used to "hardcore" games, but this is *****)
    [*]Your gameplay until 25 gold ($Mirels) = [b][Save Game] get out of Castle -> 1 battle -> load game / go back to your bed (or kitchen) to heal yourself -> repeat[/b]
    [*]When you get 25 gold you can buy some teleporter (angel flight of fortuna) - after use you got ally (and possibly armor) so you can continue.
[/list]


As fan of hard games I try to finish it... Maybe I even try to create guide - I check it just moment ago to see if there is something usable but found only one guide from game creator... "(there are 2 options about it - he 'cheated' so it was really 'easy as it looks', or he was grinding like anyone before )"
developer_response:
I must say, this person here is great. Initially wrote a bad review with detailed reasons what he considered wrong with the game, contacted me in private and gave very helpful ideas (many that have been previously given by other players) but also new and inventive ones. His active communication and desire to see the game better motivated us to revisit it and bring to you the 2.0 version. 

It's hard to know what goes behind the scenes but players can make a big impact on how a game develops or progresses. In short terms, thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990295754', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1443021659}
review:
Edited : This is version 1.0 i will try version 2.0 and update my review .

I have not finish the game yet but i want to give a short review .

I only play single player version

This game is like old classic JRPG style and i need a LOT of grinding to get through the game ( some really strong monsters that can kill me in one hit and some blocked areas that need grinding Mana to unlock) and many of expensive gears which make me want to grind grind grinding to get enough cash to buy them .

luckily i do love grinding in this game to get enough money to get items i want. ( sound like i am a shopaholic )

as well as get new strong magic when level up give me enough happiness that i can blow a pack of  strong monsters in one cast .

Annoying parts
- monsters on map chased and blocked me ( after beat them they won't disappear but only push back a little bit 
- no maps
- cannot exchange multiples Medal of Honor or Cristonia Nugget ( it need to keep pressing a button )
- F12 isn't screenshot but leave to main title ( please save often in case something gone wrong )

^_^ apart from that i like the game so far 8/10

the price is a little high in the UK but if you can get it on sale or cheap price then it is a must buy . 

ps. i will update review when i beat the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107147949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1443297605}
review:
This is for the offline single-player RPG.

DISCLAIMER: I did not beat this game. I couldn't take any more grinding to get past the probably final dungeon, after the random encounter enemies were wiping me out despite being at level 50+ and having the best armor.

It's stock art, enemies and sound. RPGmaker stock stuff isn't bad but it shows a relative lack of effort. Major enemies and allies share sprites as well - I thought Samson had betrayed me or something but it was actually just some guy who was identical. The plot is relatively standard stuff: You, the sole capable fighter in the kingdom, must fight the entire army of darkness alone. Naked and armed with a long knife.

The main method of unlocking new towns and dungeons is mana collection. You collect mana by playing tag with angels inside of trees and caves. I'm not exaggerating, that's exactly what you do. You need to catch about 10 angels per dungeon (more or less, as the mana gain is randomized) while dodging enemies and going back to respawn the angels at a prayer point. It's pretty tedious.

There's a lot of grinding, but levels are useless aside from skill and HP/MP gain. Equipment is nearly the sole factor in victory or defeat. You also get only a pittance of money for each win. 'Sidequests' involve collecting a rare drop from enemies and turning it in repeatedly for a slightly better XP and cash gain.

The party system has some issues. The main character and his healer friend are permanent, leaving you with two spaces. The first three allies you unlock have the same class, equips and skills with only slightly different stat growths. The next three, halfway into the game, are a clone of the main character, a clone of the healer and a slightly different clone of the main character. There's also party switching. It's broken! If you do it wrong you can permanently lose a character, and even if you do it right your old and new characters lose all levels and gear! Why is this? Many games have figured out dynamic parties, it's not a new thing.

Item crafting is lame. First you have to grind enemies or certain respawning material points (similar to angels, but the ore doesn't run from you). It takes a good deal per item, and you need something like 2700 for a full set. Additionally, you're capped at 99 like every other item so you need to go back from time to time and drop them off. God forbid you pick up a chest full of the stuff without having  the space. The worst part of that is that after you collect the raw materials, you need to go 'refine' them. It takes five confirm presses to refine one item. There is no option for mass refinery. So if you want that end-game gear you'd better be ready to stand around and mash Z for a solid hour.

This may be a bug, but on-field enemies don't despawn. You can get caught in normal random battles, and flee or win as normal. But visible enemies pursue you and force you into a no-escape fight if they catch up. Even if you win, they don't go away - just take a step back (if they aren't blocked) and stop chasing you a while. God help you if you get caught in a hallway or have two enemies blocking you in a corner.

Pretty much the only thing this game has going for it is an active and interested creator. Overall I have no idea why you would pay $20 for this game! It might be good to kill ten hours if you got it for free. There are better RPGmaker games available.
developer_response:
Although this is a negative review, I actually liked it. Many of the things you pointed out are things we've acknowledged and considered needed changes. Players still seem to like the game in spite of some of the issues and we've re-released the game based upon user requests. We have also (since this review) released a 2.0 updated version based upon some of the very issues stated in this review. 

Your review seemed honest, genuine and very inspiring. Although this is an old title, you (and through other player requests and suggestions) helped to encourage us to do a re-make of the game (not a sequel). Look for the new version next year.

As you may already know, we have since released a 2.0 version correcting a lot of the issues you've complained about. We are still working on a better version that is a total re-make done from the ground up. *I hope you will still consider trying our game in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114106289', 'num_games_owned': 6484, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1430039033}
review:
[h1][i] 차라리 한국 클래식 MMORPG를 하세요. [/i][/h1]

[h1]장점[/h1]

+MMORPG 지원
+도전적인 난이도 (싱글 한정)


[h1]단점[/h1]

-[b]스팀 오버레이 미지원[/b]
-[b]3자 DRM 강요[/b] (멀티 컨텐츠 한정)
-랜덤 인카운터 + 심볼 인카운터 (멀티시 심볼 인카운터 온리)
-MMORPG로 진행시 전투 간략화
-전형적인 JRPG 기본틀


[h1]주의점[/h1]

MMORPG로 플레이하고 싶을 경우 추가 파일을 윈도우 시스템폴더에 설치합니다.


[h1]이런 분들에게 추천합니다.[/h1]

쯔꾸르장르를 한번도 안해보신 분들중 쯔꾸르로 MMORPG를 가볍게 해보실 분


[h1]이런 분들에게 비추천합니다.[/h1]

쯔꾸르 커뮤니티 사이트에 한번이라도 가보신 분
소위 말하는 명작 쯔꾸르게임을 한 작품이라도 해보신 분

author: {'steamid': '76561198149511067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1421258412}
review: I was looking forward and had great expectations for this game, I was utterly disappointed.The most annoying aspects were the battles, you were minding your own business walking on the map and suddenly a battle breaks loose, with no warning, you couldn't see any beasts on the map before you were forced into battle so you were not prepared.Also a idiotic feature, the waste of space houses and endless roads, everything was repetitive and boring. I tried to like it but it gave me no chance.My eagerness for exploration was utterly smashed by my frustration with those endless boooring battles out of the blue. I could continue to state why I dislike this game, anyway if you want a decent 2D RPG I recommend visiting Aveyond Kindom, I played a lot of their games and not once was I this disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072210817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1418477028}
review:
My first 5 minutes:
Why isn't the controller responding? Ah, cursor keys work... wait.. X instead of A button? Back to controller.
Found armor that I can't equip.... in my room, for females. Cloud?!
This castle only got 3 areas and the kings aides are shopkeepers? Wait, I got NO armor on? Its over 100 $ ?
So, outside the castle has architecture as weird as inside.
Oh random encounter..
3 enemies? Woah, they hit for almost 20 % of my health!
I don't have any skills?
Run back inside to heal after winning, at least my bed is free.
Can't afford armor yet, thats still over 100 $ away.
Fiddlesticks... random encounter, barely survied, a disgraced NPC with bad story explanation directly in front of the castle and moving dogs that ALSO trigger fights... that surrounded me by randomly walking while the npc keeps talking.
Dead.

I don't mind hard, some of my favourite games on steam have permadeath. This isn't hard, it's unbalanced.
If you are a fan you might want it. Otherwise there are other games on steam that are more fun in the same price range.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997172478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1013, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1418223425}
review:
One of the better games made in RPG maker I have ever played. Reminiscent of dragon quest and final fantasy.
The story, the style of the game takes you back to the days when RPGs were made in such a way that the world of the game thrills you into it.
